item.title: Wayback Webapp Hacking
item.author: mubix
item.description: Archive.org allows you to check the history of sites and pages, but a service most are not aware of is one that allows you to get a list of every page that a Archive.org has for a given domain. This is great for enumerating a web applications, many times you’ll find parts of web apps that have been long forgotten (and usually vulnerable). This module doesn’t make any requests to the targeted domain, it simply outputs a list to the screen/or a file of all the pages it has found on Archive.
